info.title: SendGrid
info.description: Allows SendGrid customers to retrieve account information such as statistics, bounces, spam reports, and unsubscribes.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Retrieve the timestamp of the Block records. It will return a date in a MySQL timestamp format – YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. Must be set to 1.

parameters.name: days
parameters.description: Number of days in the past for which to retrieve blocks (includes today). If specified, must be an integer greater than 0.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start of the date range for which to retrieve blocks. Date must be in YYYY-MM-DD format and be earlier than the end_date parameter.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end of the date range for which to retrieve blocks. Date must be in YYYY-MM-DD format and be later than the start_date parameter.

get.description: Retrieves a list of Blocks with addresses and response codes, optionally with dates.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email block address to remove. Must be a valid user account email.

get.description: Deletes an address from the Block list.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Retrieve the timestamp of the bounce records. It will return a date in a MySQL timestamp format – YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. Must be set to 1.

parameters.name: days
parameters.description: Number of days in the past for which to retrieve bounces (includes today). If specified, must be an integer greater than 0.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start of the date range for which to retrieve bounces. Date must be in YYYY-MM-DD format and be earlier than the end_date parameter.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end of the date range for which to retrieve bounces. Date must be in YYYY-MM-DD format and be later than the start_date parameter.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of results returned.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Beginning point in the list to retrieve from.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of bounce to search for. Valid values: hard or soft.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email addresses to search for.

get.description: Retrieves a list of bounces with addresses and response codes, optionally with dates.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Date to start deleting from. Date must be in YYYY-mm-dd format and be before the end_date parameter.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Date to end deleting from. Date must be in YYYY-mm-dd format and be after the start_date parameter.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of bounce to be removed. Valid values: hard or soft.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email bounce address to remove.

get.description: Deletes an address from the Bounce list. Please note that if no parameters are specified the ENTIRE list will be deleted.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Optional date to start counting from. Date must be in YYYY-mm-dd format and be before the end_date parameter.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: date to end counting from. Date must be in YYYY-mm-dd format and be after the start_date parameter.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of bounce to search for. Valid values: hard or soft.

get.description: Counts the total number of bounces.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

get.description: Retrieves the event notification URL which currently receives event notifications.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL to receive event notifications from.

get.description: Sets the event notification URL.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

get.description: Deletes the event notification URL.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

get.description: List all of the available apps. Note: The name entry is used in all the other API calls to identify a app. For a list of all the apps and parameters accesible with the Web API you can check the Filter Settings page, http://docs.sendgrid.com/documentation/api/web-api/filtersettings.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the app.

get.description: Activates an app.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the app.

get.description: Deactivates an app.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the app.

get.description: Get filter settings.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Retrieve the timestamp of the invalid email records. It will return a date in a MySQL timestamp format – YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. Must be set to 1.

parameters.name: days
parameters.description: Number of days in the past for which to retrieve invalid emails (includes today). If specified, must be an integer greater than 0.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start of the date range for which to retrieve invalid emails. Date must be in YYYY-MM-DD format and be earlier than the end_date parameter.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end of the date range for which to retrieve invalid emails. Date must be in YYYY-MM-DD format and be later than the start_date parameter.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of results returned.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Beginning point in the list to retrieve from.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email addresses to search for.

get.description: Retrieves a list of invalid emails with addresses and response codes, optionally with dates.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The date to start deleting at. Date must be in YYYY-mm-dd format and be before the end_date parameter.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The date to end deleting at. Date must be in YYYY-mm-dd format and be after the start_date parameter.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Invalid Email address to remove. Must be a valid user account email.

get.description: Deletes an address from the Invalid Email list. Please note that if no parameters are submitted the ENTIRE list will be deleted.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The date to start counting from. Date must be in YYYY-mm-dd format and be before the end_date parameter.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The date to end counting from. Date must be in YYYY-mm-dd format and be after the start_date parameter.

get.description: Counts the total number of invalid emails.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

get.description: Pull down the settings already configured for parsing incoming email.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: hostname
parameters.description: The host name.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL.

parameters.name: spam_check
parameters.description: Whether to check or not for spam.

get.description: Specify the hostname and url for parsing incoming emails.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: hostname
parameters.description: The host name.

get.description: Deletes the existing settings for parsing incoming emails.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

get.description: View your SendGrid profile.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: first_name
parameters.description: Your first name.

parameters.name: last_name
parameters.description: Your last name.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Company address.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: City where your company is located.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: State where your company is located.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: Country where your company is located.

parameters.name: zip
parameters.description: Zipcode where your company is located.

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: Valid phone number where we can reach you.

parameters.name: website
parameters.description: Your company’s website.

get.description: Selectively update your profile without other information being modified.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Your new password. Must be at least 6 characters.

parameters.name: confirm_password
parameters.description: Confrim new password. Must match password parameter and be at least 6 characters long.

get.description: Resets your password.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: This is the new username we will be authenticating with our SMTP servers and our website. Changes take effect immediately. Must not exceed 100 characters. The username cannot be already taken or contain the SendGrid.com domain.

get.description: The account username is used to login to our SMTP server and the website. Changes will take effect immediately.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: This is the new email address we will be contacting you with. Changes take effect immediately. Must be in email format and not more than 100 characters.

get.description: We send out a confirmation email to the new email account in order to be validated. Your email address changes when you click on the confirmation link.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Retrieve the timestamp of the spam report records. It will return a date in a MySQL timestamp format – YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. Must be set to 1.

parameters.name: days
parameters.description: Number of days in the past for which to retrieve spam reports (includes today). If specified, must be an integer greater than 0.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start of the date range for which to retrieve spam reports. Date must be in YYYY-MM-DD format and be earlier than the end_date parameter.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end of the date range for which to retrieve spam reports. Date must be in YYYY-MM-DD format and be later than the start_date parameter.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of results returned.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Beginning point in the list to retrieve from.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email addresses to search for.

get.description: Retrieves a list of spam reports with addresses and response codes, optionally with dates.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email spam reports address to remove. Must be a valid user account email.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The date to start deleting at. Date must be in YYYY-mm-dd format and be before the end_date parameter.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The date to end deleting at. Date must be in YYYY-mm-dd format and be after the start_date parameter.

get.description: Deletes an address from the Spam Reports list.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The date to start counting from. Date must be in YYYY-mm-dd format and be before the end_date parameter.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The date to end counting from. Date must be in YYYY-mm-dd format and be after the start_date parameter.

get.description: Counts the total number of spam reports.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: aggregate
parameters.description: The category you will specify to retrieve detailed stats. Must be an existing category that has statistics. This can also be passed in as an array, to send to multiple categories (i.e. category[]={category1}&category[]={category2}&...&category[]={categoryN)).

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: The category you will specify to retrieve detailed stats. Must be an existing category that has statistics.

parameters.name: days
parameters.description: Number of days in the past to include statistics (includes today). Must be an integer greater than 0.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start date to look up statistics. Date must be in YYYY-MM-DD format and be before the end_date parameter.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end date to look up statistics. Date must be in YYYY-MM-DD format and be after the start_date parameter.

get.description: Retrieves statistics broken down by category. If the category does not exist, there will be an empty result set. Note that you can use either the days parameter or the start_date and end_date parameter.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Retrieve the timestamp of the unsubscribe records. It will return a date in a MySQL timestamp format – YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. Must be set to 1.

parameters.name: days
parameters.description: Number of days in the past for which to retrieve unsubscribes (includes today). If specified, must be an integer greater than 0.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start of the date range for which to retrieve unsubscribes. Date must be in YYYY-MM-DD format and be earlier than the end_date parameter.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end of the date range for which to retrieve unsubscribes. Date must be in YYYY-MM-DD format and be later than the start_date parameter.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of results returned.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Beginning point in the list to retrieve from.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email addresses to search for.

get.description: Retrieves a list of Unsubscribes with addresses and optionally with dates.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The date to start retrieving for. Date must be in YYYY-mm-dd format and be before the end_date parameter.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The date to end retrieving for. Date must be in YYYY-mm-dd format and be after the start_date parameter.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Unsubscribed email address to remove. Must be a valid user account email.

get.description: Deletes an address from the Unsubscribe list. Please note that if no parameters are provided the ENTIRE list will be removed.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email address to add to unsubscribe list. Must be a valid email address.

get.description: Adds an email address to the Unsubscribe list.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The date to start counting from. Date must be in YYYY-mm-dd format and be before the end_date parameter.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The date to end counting from. Date must be in YYYY-mm-dd format and be after the start_date parameter.

get.description: Counts the total number of unsubscribes.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The subuser we are retrieving bounces from. Subuser must be registered under your account.

parameters.name: task
parameters.description: This will allow you to delete the bounces for the specified user. Must be set to delete.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Bounce email address you want to delete.

get.description: Since SendGrid does not re-deliver to bounced addresses, users can remove bounces from their list at any time if redelivery to a bounced address is desired.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The subuser we are retrieving spam reports from. Subuser must be registered under your account.

parameters.name: task
parameters.description: This will allow you to delete a spam report for the specified user. Must be set to delete.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: You must specify the spam reports to remove. Must be a spam reports.

get.description: Deletes spam reports. Since SendGrid does not deliver to spam reported addresses, users can remove spam reports from their list at any time if re-delivery to a spam reported address is desired.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The subuser we are retrieving unsubscribes from. Subuser must be registered under your account.

parameters.name: task
parameters.description: This will allow you to add an unsubscribe record for the specified subuser. Must be set to add.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: You must specify the unsubscribe record to add. Must be an unsubscribe record.

get.description: Adds unsubscribe email records to their account if they need to stop sending email messages to a specific recipient.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: identity
parameters.description: The Identity that will be used for the Newsletter being created.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name that will be used for the Newsletter being created.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: The subject that will be used for the Newsletter being created.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text portion of the Newsletter being created.

parameters.name: html
parameters.description: The html portion of the Newsletter being created.

get.description: Create a new Newsletter.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Newsletter being updated.

parameters.name: newname
parameters.description: The new name for the Newsletter being edited.

parameters.name: identity
parameters.description: The new Identity for the Newsletter being edited.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: The new subject that will be used for the Newsletter being edited.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The new text portion of the Newsletter being edited.

parameters.name: html
parameters.description: The new html portion of the Newsletter being edited.

get.description: Edit an existing Newsletter.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of an existing Newsletter.

get.description: Retrieves the contents of an existing newsletter.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Search to see if a specific Newsletter exists rather than a list of all Newsletters.

get.description: Retrieve the names of all existing Newsletters, or search for a specific newsletter.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Remove the Newsletter with this name.

get.description: Remove an existing Newsletter.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: list
parameters.description: Create a Recipient List with this name.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Specify the column name for the ‘name’ associated with email addresses.

get.description: Create a new Recipient List.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: list
parameters.description: This is the name of the Recipient List to be renamed.

parameters.name: newlist
parameters.description: Specify the new name for the Recipient List.

get.description: Rename a Recipient List.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: list
parameters.description: Check for this particular list. (To list all Recipient Lists on your account exclude this parameter)

get.description: List all Recipient Lists on your account, or check if a particular List exists.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: list
parameters.description: Remove this Recipient List.

get.description: Remove a Recipient List from your account.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: list
parameters.description: The list which you are adding email addresses too. Must be an existing Recipient List.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Specify the name, email address, and additional fields to add to the specified Recipient List. Must be a valid JSON string matching the required format (i.e. {"email":"address@domain.com","name":"contactName"}). Limited to a 1000 entries maximum.

get.description: Adds one or more emails to a Recipient List.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: list
parameters.description: The list you are searching. Must be an existing Recipient List.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email addresses to search for in the Recipient List. Must be an email address or list of addresses.

get.description: Gets the email addresses and associated fields for a Recipient List.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: list
parameters.description: The list which you are removing email addresses from. Must be an existing Recipient List.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Specify the email address or email addresses you wish to remove from the specified Recipient List. Must be an email or emails in the Recipient List.

get.description: Removes one or more emails from a Recipient List.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: identity
parameters.description: Create an Identity named this.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Specify the name to be used for this Identity.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Specify the email address to be used for this Identity.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Specify the physical address to be used for this Identity.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: Specify the city to be used for this Identity.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Specify the state code to be used for this Identity.

parameters.name: zip
parameters.description: Specify the zip code to be used for this Identity.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: Specify the country code to be used for this Identity.

get.description: Creates a new Identity.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: identity
parameters.description: The Identity you wish to edit. Must be an existing Identity.

parameters.name: newidentity
parameters.description: Specify the new name to be used for this Identity.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Specify the new name to be used for this Identity.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Specify the new email address to be used for this Identity.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Specify the new physical address to be used for this Identity.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: Specify the new physical address to be used for this Identity.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Specify the new physical address to be used for this Identity.

parameters.name: zip
parameters.description: Specify the new zip code to be used for this Identity.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: Specify the new country code to be used for this Identity.

get.description: Edits the contact information in an existing Identity.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: identity
parameters.description: The Identity you wish to retrieve. Must be an existing Identity.

get.description: Retrieves contact information associated with a particular Identity.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: identity
parameters.description: Check for this particular Identity. (To list all Identities on your account exclude this parameter).

get.description: Lists all Identities on your account, or check if a particular Identity exists.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: identity
parameters.description: Remove the specified Identity from your account. Must be an existing Identity.

get.description: Removes an Identity from your account.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: This is the Newsletter to which you are adding Recipients Lists. Must be an existing Newsletter.

parameters.name: list
parameters.description: This is the Recipient List that will be added to the Newsletter. Must be one or more existing Recipient Lists.

get.description: Adds one or more Recipient List to a Newsletter.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Retrieve the Recipient Lists of an existing Newsletter. Must be an existing Newsletter.

get.description: Retrieves the Recipient Lists associated with a Newsletter.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Newsletter to remove Recipient Lists from. Must be an existing Newsletter.

parameters.name: list
parameters.description: Recipient Lists to remove. Must be one or more existing Recipient Lists.

get.description: Removes a Recipient List from a Newsletter.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Newsletter to schedule delivery for (if Newsletter should be sent now, include no additional parameters). Must be an existing Newsletter.

parameters.name: at
parameters.description: Date/Time to schedule newsletter Delivery. Date/Time must be provided in ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS +-HH:MM).

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Number of minutes until delivery should occur. Must be a positive integer.

get.description: Creates a new schedule event.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Retrieve the delivery time scheduled for this Newsletter. Must be an existing Newsletter.

get.description: Retrieves the scheduled event associated with a Newsletter.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Retrieve the delivery time scheduled for this Newsletter. Must be an existing Newsletter.

get.description: Removes a scheduled event from a Newsletter.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: This is the start date to begin your invoice search from. Must be in YYYY-mm-dd format.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: This is the end date for your invoice search. Must be in YYYY-mm-dd format.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: This is used to specify what kind of invoice you would like returned. Must be either paid, unpaid, refunded, deferred, canceled.

get.description: Retrieve Invoice Numbers.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines the response format. It can be either json for a JSON response or xml for an XML response.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: This is the start date to begin your invoice search from. Must be in YYYY-mm-dd format.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: This is the end date for your invoice search. Must be in YYYY-mm-dd format.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: This is used to specify what kind of invoice you would like returned. Must be either paid, unpaid, refunded, deferred, canceled.

get.description: Retrieve Invoices.

info.title: SendGrid
info.description: Allows SendGrid customers to retrieve account information such as statistics, bounces, spam reports, and unsubscribes.
